results.title: Trumpet, horn and trombone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Listening to Music”
The film introduces the trumpet, horn and trombone and shows in close-up the basic techniques of producing sound from the instruments. The use of the lips to produce a harmonic series is clearly demonstrated. In the case of the trumpet and the horn the use of the valve mechanism, and the slide in the case of the trombone, are also explained.

results.title: Trumpet and cornet
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
Part of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. Professional musicians, Glenn Madden and Gary Foot, demonstrate how the trumpet and the cornet are played, their range and tone, and show how to care for these instruments.

results.title: Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from C-Span's YouTube channel
results.brief_description: After years of consuming viral misinformation, pro-Trump insurgents stormed the US Capitol building in early 2021, pausing their vandalising and looting only to take selfies, as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet ropes, despite dismissing democracy.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Screen recording of C-Span’s news footage ‘Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes’
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.

results.title: Truman and the Korean war
results.brief_description: Presents a journalist’s perspective of the Korean War supplemented by excellent footage, and outlines the role played by Truman and MacArthur, noting the events that led to MacArthur’s being relieved of his command. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Truman and the Cold War
results.brief_description: Provides a background to the development of the Cold War. Includes graphic footage of the plight of refugees in post-war Europe; notes the Truman doctrine of giving aid to free nations threatened by aggression, by providing a case study of Greece where partisans supported by communists strove to get rid of the monarchy; the Marshall Aid Program; the Berlin Blockade and the consequent formation of NATO. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Truman
results.brief_description: A brief biography starts the story of President Truman as he is sworn in as President in 1945 and carries it through his eight eventful years in the White House; the final stages of World War II in Europe and Asia, domestic developments and the Truman doctrine.
